aboutMe: Hi, I'm Michael Tanel and welcome to my site! I am a recent B.ASc graduate from Queen's University for software engineering, and I am looking for a full-time position as a software developer/technical consultant.

The majority of my consulting work has been involving internal stakeholders from other departments, but I have also done some freelance work for a company where I would recommend software and write reports summarizing how the software solution I chose would solve their business problem.
I really enjoyed this work, and I would like to pursue a career in software development or technical consulting.
aboutWebsite: This website was designed with Angular 7, and Google Material Design.

description: Full stack developer, working with Docker, Express.js for Node.js, React, Redux, CSS to roll out new features, continuous improvements, and bugfixes on a weekly release basis

Replaced a paper ticket system used to track part and tool rentals. Roughly 20 hours per week were being wasted managing this paper system.
Myself, along with a junior co-op developer, were given the opportunity to design and implement a web solution to manage the parts and tools.

I was the lead developer andproject manager. I designed the database schema and setup the servers required for the project which included: database server running MariaDB, Apache server with PHP5, a GitLab server to host our code repository.
Using Angular 6 and Google Material Design, we implemented a clean and user friendly website to manage these parts and tools in a more efficient manner.

Designed and implemented a relational database model consisting of 23 tables.
Supported an aviation maintenance management software product for the commercial and defense industries.
Main responsibilities included: feature design and implementation, bug fixes, code reviews, and documentation.

The first project focused on a legacy system, managing parts and tools used for aircraft maintenance and employee scheduling. The second project focused on a separate aircraft maintenance scheduling application.
Key technologies and approaches: PostgreSQL, AngularJS, Java backend, Docker, Shippable, Bit Bucket, Git, agile methodology.
